meanings.definition: A type of ancient Greek or Roman warship with three tiers of oars on each side.
meanings.sent1: The triremes sailed gracefully across the sea.
meanings.sent2: Historians study the design of triremes to understand ancient naval warfare.
meanings.sent3: The triremes had a race, but one ship kept going in circles!
meanings.sent4: In my dream, triremes transformed into giant swans gliding on the water.
meanings.sent5: The triremes' oars moved in perfect harmony, like dancers in a ballet.

meanings.definition: The plural form of trireme, referring to multiple ancient warships with three tiers of oars on each side.
meanings.sent1: Legends tell of epic battles fought with fleets of triremes.
meanings.sent2: The harbor was filled with the majestic sight of many triremes at anchor.
meanings.sent3: During the festival, children played with toy triremes in the fountain.
meanings.sent4: The triremes lined up like soldiers ready for a historic reenactment.
meanings.sent5: The paintings depicted the triremes as symbols of power and conquest.
